alert.note: Alert for Bell; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 9:50AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Bell and southeastern Whitley Counties through 1015 AM EDT... At 950 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Wilkerson, or 12 miles west of Middlesboro, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Fonde and Chenoa around 955 AM EDT. Davisburg around 1000 AM EDT. Middlesboro, Noetown and Binghamtown around 1005 AM EDT. Hutch, Meldrum, Ferndale and Ponza around 1010 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Oaks. THIS INCLUDES U.S. Highway 25 East in Bell County between mile markers 1 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
